list.markScheme: →\ce{->}​structure A: α-glucose[1]→\ce{->}​structure B: ribose[1]→\ce{->}​structure A: starchORglycogenORamyloseORamylopectin[1]→\ce{->}​structure B: ribonucleic acidORRNA[1]

list.title: Question 68
list.content:
The electron micrograph below shows a cell of the bacteriumVibrio cholerae. Which of the labelled structures maintains the cell’s shape and protects the cell from lysing during osmosis?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/736cd18e-ee65-4f82-8af4-eb1a43c8be73/images/5dc39b3e-60d2-488c-8d82-06070c9413d6/BI0494.png)

[Source: Blokesch, M. & Schoolnik, G.K. (2007).Serogroup Conversion of Vibrio cholerae in Aquatic Reservoirs. PLoS Pathog 3(6): e81. Retrieved March 15, 2022, from https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.ppat.0030081.Copyright under CC BY 4.0]
list.markScheme:
BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The cell membrane of prokaryotes is surrounded by a rigid cell wall. The cell wall provides shape and structure to the organism. It also prevents the cell from bursting when the cell takes up water through osmosis.  The cell wall is located between the cell membrane and the capsule, a sticky outer layer of polysaccharide. The cell wall is shown in the image below.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/736cd18e-ee65-4f82-8af4-eb1a43c8be73/images/186347c3-bad0-4ecf-8cb6-3d8e5822df69/BI0494A.png)

list.title: Question 69
list.content: What determines the overall size of a eukaryotic genome?A.\hspace{1em}The number of genesB.\hspace{1em}The number of chromosomesC.\hspace{1em}The amount of proteinD.\hspace{1em}The total amount of DNA
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The number of genes contributes to the overall size of the genome, but it is not the sole determinant. Eukaryotic genomes contain a significant amount of noncoding DNA.  The amount of this non-coding DNA is a major contributing factor to the overall size of a eukaryotic genome.Choice Ais incorrect.Chromosomes vary greatly in the number of genes and noncoding DNA they contain. Simply knowing the number of chromosomes in a genome does little to describe the size of the genome.Choice Bis incorrect.Choice Cis incorrect because a genome is a measure of only the amount of DNA and does not consider protein.Choice Dis the correct choice because it is the total amount of DNA in a genome that determines the size of that genome, regardless of the function of the DNA.

list.title: Question 70
list.content: Which of the following options correctly identifies the forms of DNA and the types of ribosomes found in prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?Prokaryotic DNAEukaryotic DNAProkaryotic RibosomesEukaryotic RibosomesA.\hspace{1em}LinearCircular80S70SB.\hspace{1em}CircularLinear80S80SC.\hspace{1em}CircularLinear70S80SD.\hspace{1em}LinearLinear70S70S
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Prokaryotic cells have circular DNA and 70S ribosomes, while eukaryotic cells have linear DNA and 80S ribosomes. Therefore,Choice Cis correct.Choices A, BandDare incorrect because they do not have the correct combinations.

list.title: Question 71
list.content: Which set of bonds found in nucleic acids are correctly identified in the table below?Bonds between phosphates and pentose sugarsBonds between nucleotide basesA.\hspace{1em}CovalentHydrogenB.\hspace{1em}HydrogenCovalentC.\hspace{1em}CovalentCovalentD.\hspace{1em}HydrogenHydrogen
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because the nucleic acid backbone is held together by covalently bonded sugars and phosphates, while the nucleotide bases are held together by hydrogen bonds.Choice Bis incorrect because the types of bonds are reversed.Choice Cis incorrect because the bonds between nucleotides are hydrogen bonds, not covalent bonds.Choice Dis incorrect because the bonds between phosphates and pentose sugars are covalent, not hydrogen bonds.

list.title: Question 72
list.content:
The diagram shows the structure of a DNA fragment.Which letter points to the bonds that easily break and reform?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/a626ffc3-c2e5-4f07-aa13-46af1143e26b/images/b46d0542-b068-4146-8497-4b93a1868de1/BI0038.png)

[Source: Adapted from User: Madprime. (2010, March).File: DNA chemical structure jp.svg. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved May 15, 2022, fromhttps://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: DNA_chemical_structure_jp.svg.Copyright under CC-SA 3.0]
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The bonds between the nitrogenous bases holding the two strands together are hydrogen bonds. Hydrogen bonds typically break and reform easily; thereforeChoice Bis the correct answer to the question.The nitrogenous bases consist of single and double covalent bonds (Choice A) between nitrogen and carbon atoms. Deoxyribose sugars have single covalent bonds (Choice C) between the carbon atoms forming the pentose sugar. There are covalent bonds between the phosphate and sugar and between the phosphate and base (Choice D). Covalent bonds do not typically break and reform easily.

list.title: Question 73
list.content:
Which organelle is the site of protein synthesis?A.B.

list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because it shows the rough endoplasmic reticulum, which has bound ribosomes that synthesise proteins.Choice Ashows the nucleus which contains the genetic information and controls the activity of the cell.Choice Cshows a chloroplast, the site of photosynthesis.Choice Dindicates the golgi apparatus which packages and transports proteins.

list.title: Question 74
list.content:
What feature distinguishes fungal hyphae and striated muscle from the two cell types shown in the images?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/aa05a687-8639-4d5b-b98e-676e515e3db9/images/cb9d1305-aecb-4b44-9d15-1ffb1d245817/bi0756.png)

[Source: Adapted from CNX OpenStax. (2016, May 27).File04 00 00.jpg.Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved March 5, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Figure_04_00_00.jpg Copyright under CC by 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}They are multinucleate.B.\hspace{1em}They only have one nucleus.C.\hspace{1em}They have unusually large cells that contain only one nucleus.D.\hspace{1em}They contain mitochondria.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Fungal hyphae and striated muscle are both exceptions to the cell theory as they are much larger than typical cells and are multinucleate.Choice Bis incorrect as the diagrams depict onion epidermis cells and mast cells, which each contain one nucleus.Choice Cis incorrect as both fungal hyphae and striated muscles contain multiple nuclei.Choice Dis incorrect as fungal hyphae, striated muscle AND the cells in the diagram all contain mitochondria.

list.title: Question 75
list.content: Which of the following molecules are classified as nucleic acids?I.ATPII.rRNAIII.DNAA.\hspace{1em}I and IIB.\hspace{1em}I and IIIC.\hspace{1em}II and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis false. ATP (adenosine triphosphate) is a nucleotide, not a nucleic acid. It is a single molecule, not a long chain (polymer) of nucleotides, which is what defines nucleic acids like DNA and RNA.Statement IIis true. Ribosomal RNA (rRNA) is a type of RNA, which is one of the two major types of nucleic acids (the other being DNA). It is a polymer of ribonucleotides, synthesised during transcription, and plays a role in protein synthesis.Statement IIIis true. DNA is a polymer of deoxyribonucleotides. It serves as the hereditary material in most organisms.Note that the correct answer includes the two molecules whose names end in ‘NA’, which stands for nucleic acid - DNA and RNA.Choice Cis, therefore, the correct answer as it only includes the two trueStatements IIandIII.Choices A, BandDare incorrect as they include the falseStatement I.

list.title: Question 76
list.content: Which of the following correctly pairs the structure with the type of cell in which it is found?StructureType of cellA.\hspace{1em}Nucleoid regionAnimalB.\hspace{1em}Cell wallProkaryoticC.\hspace{1em}ChloroplastFungal cellD.\hspace{1em}Sap vacuoleProkaryotic
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because nearly all prokaryotic cells possess a cell wall that provides structure, support, and protection.Choice Ais incorrect because a nucleoid region is characteristic of a prokaryotic cell, not an animal cell.Choice Cis incorrect because chloroplasts are found in plants and some algae cells, but not fungi.Choice Dis incorrect because sap vacuoles are characteristic of plant cells, not prokaryotic cells.

list.title: Question 77
list.content: The okapi looks like a small-sized giraffe and has stripes that resemble the zebra. It lives in the Ituri Forest in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Okapis eat the leaves and buds of trees they can reach. They also graze on grass and ferns and eat fruit. Okapis tend to be solitary animals and the mother gives birth to one offspring which continues to be dependent on the mother’s milk for six months. When they are four to five years old, they are mature and can breed, but only with other okapis.Which of the following statements is applicable to the okapi?I.Okapi is a hybrid of a giraffe and a zebraII.Okapi is an herbivoreIII.Okapi is its own speciesA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I and III only
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Okapi is a herbivore(II)because it only eats plants. Okapi is a species(III)since it can interbreed and produce fertile offspring.They are not a hybrid of a giraffe and a zebra (I), even though they look like one.

list.title: Question 78
list.content: The cohesive and adhesive properties of water allow xylem vessels to transport water inside plants.Which of the following are correct descriptions of how these properties are related to water transport in plants?CohesiveAdhesive\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.Polar water molecules are attracted to the hydrophilic cell walls in xylem.\hspace{1em}B.\hspace{1em}Water molecules are polar, so are able to dissolve ionsPolar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.\hspace{1em}C.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form oxygen bonds.Water molecules are polar, so are able to dissolve ions\hspace{1em}D.\hspace{1em}Polar water molecules are attracted to the hydrophilic cell walls in xylem.Polar water molecules are attracted to one another and form hydrogen bonds.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Water is cohesive because it is a polar molecule. The oxygen atom in one water molecule forms a hydrogen bond with the hydrogen atom of another water molecule. In xylem vessels water is attracted to the hydrophilic regions of the cell wall and hydrogen bonds are formed.  This an accurate description of the adhesive properties of water in the context of water transport in plants (Choice A). These statements are reversed inChoice D.Ions dissolve in water, but this is not related to the cohesive (Choice B) or adhesive (Choice C) properties of water.

list.title: Question 79
list.content: Which of the following rows correctly pairs the cell type with its nuclear characteristic?Cell typeNuclear stateA.\hspace{1em}Phloem sieve tube elementsNo nucleusB.\hspace{1em}Skeletal muscle cellsSingle nucleusC.\hspace{1em}Red blood cellsSingle nucleusD.\hspace{1em}Aseptate fungal hyphaeNo nucleus
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because phloem sieve tube elements lose their nucleus as they mature to facilitate the transport of sugars.Choice Bis incorrect because skeletal muscle cells are multinucleated to accommodate their length.Choice Cis incorrect because mature red blood cells lack a nucleus. They jettison the nucleus when mature to increase the haemoglobin capacity of oxygen transport.Choice Dis incorrect because aseptate fungal hyphae have a continuous cytoplasm containing many nuclei.

list.title: Question 80
list.content: Which definitions are matched to the correct form of diversity?Ecosystem diversityGenetic diversitySpecies diversityA.\hspace{1em}Different habitats, communities and ecological processesThe type of alleles in a populationGenetic variation within a speciesB.\hspace{1em}The number of species and their abundance in an areaPhenotypic variation in a communityGenetic variability within a speciesC.\hspace{1em}Variety and abundance of different ecosystems in a geographical areaGenetic variability within a species or populationThe number of species and their abundance in an areaD.\hspace{1em}Different habitats, communities and ecological processesThe total number and type of epigenetic markers in a populationThe variety of all life on Earth
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Ecosystem diversity is defined as the variety and abundance of different ecosystems present in a geographical area. Genetic diversity is the genetic variability within a species or population. Species diversity is the number and relative abundance of species found in a specific area. ThereforeChoice Cis correct.Choice Ais incorrect because genetic diversity does not only refer to the type of alleles in a population but the number of different alleles in a population.Choice Bis incorrect because phenotypic variation refers to differences in observable characteristics, not genetic diversity, and the definition of ecosystem diversity shown in row B is actually the definition for species diversity.Choice Dis incorrect as genetic diversity does not relate to the control of the expression of genes (epigenetics) within a population and the variety of all life on Earth is the definition for biodiversity.

list.title: Question 81
list.content: Which is the most significant factor in the loss of global biodiversity being experienced in the 21st century?A.\hspace{1em}IndustrialisationB.\hspace{1em}Human population growthC.\hspace{1em}Invasive plant speciesD.\hspace{1em}Deforestation
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because the rapid growth in human population (which has included a doubling in the period 1960-2020) has put pressure on all the Earth’s resources that humans rely upon. In doing so, habitat loss has had a major negative effect on thousands of species across all five kingdoms.Choices A, CandDare all incorrect; whilst they are all factors contributing to global biodiversity loss, they are not the overarching cause. The question asks for the ‘most significant factor’, which is human population growth.

list.title: Question 82
list.markScheme: BSample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:RNA is a single strand of nucleotides (Uracil, Guanine, Adenine and Cytosine), bonded together by a phosphodiester backbone. Each nucleotide consists of a phosphate group (represented by a circle), joined to a ribose sugar (represented by a pentagon) joined to a base (represented by a rectangle). Each nucleotide is joined to another by a covalent bond between the  ribose sugar of one nucleotide and the phosphate of the next.Choice Bis correct.Choice Ais incorrect as RNA is single stranded, not double stranded.Choice Cis incorrect as it shows a hexose sugar rather than a pentose sugar.Choice Dis incorrect as the pentose sugars and phosphate groups are in the wrong positions.

list.title: Question 83
list.content:
The electric blue tarantula (Chilobrachys natanicharum, pictured below) is a newly-listed (2023) species found in the mangrove swamps of south-western Thailand. The vivid blue colour is created by nanostructures on the spider’s hairs that produce an iridescent effect.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2d9c8dd7-9273-4363-b0f3-46ca62fdff2e/images/3130ca0e-d70d-4ae6-9e0f-9a2d58bbfde3/BI2808.png)

The electric blue tarantulaChilobrachys natanicharum[Source: Chomphuphuang, Narinet al(2024 March, 28), File:Chilobrachys natanicharum2[image]. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved 2025 April, 30 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Chilobrachys_natanicharum2.jpg. CC BY 4.0]Which statement about the electric blue tarantula is most likely to be correct?A.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula would be able to mate successfully with another tarantula found in Thailand,Chilobrachys huahini, and produce fertile offspring.B.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula has recently evolved from darker-coloured species of tarantula.C.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula was previously classified in the class Insecta (insects).D.\hspace{1em}The electric blue tarantula has existed for a long time, but was not discovered until recently.
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because, like the vast majority of animal species that live on Earth today, this species had been unknown to humans. It has existed in remote areas away from human habitation, in a niche that makes it a rare global species. As such, it was not discovered until 2023, when human intervention to prevent habitat loss to palm oil farming identified the species.Choice Ais incorrect becauseChilobrachys huahiniis a distinct species; only members of the same species can reproduce successfully and produce fertile offspring.Choice Bis incorrect because there is no evidence of the recent emergence of this species; it is more likely to have been undiscovered for a long time.Choice Cis incorrect because all spiders, including the tarantula, belong to the classArachnida(arachnids). The key difference is the number of pairs of legs; insects have 3 pairs, whereas arachnids have 4 pairs.

list.title: Question 84
list.content: Which of the following statement(s) is/are true for the genome?I.The genome is all the genetic information of an organism.II.Genomes within a species are identical in size.III.Genomes within a species vary in base sequence.A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme:
CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The genome is all the genetic information in an organism (Statement I). The base sequence can vary within a species due to single-nucleotide polymorphism (Statement III). Therefore,Choice Cis correct as it contains both true statements.Choice Ais incorrect as it only includes one true statement.
The size of the genome within a species can vary, this can be due to mutations, such as insertions and deletions, soStatement IIis not true.Choices BandDare, therefore, incorrect.

list.title: Question 85
list.content: What is the main cause of Southeast Asia's loss of dipterocarp forest ecosystems?A.\hspace{1em}Plantations of palm oil (Elaeis guineensis)B.\hspace{1em}Fungal disease affecting treesC.\hspace{1em}Nutrient depletion in the soilD.\hspace{1em}Anthropogenic climate change
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because palm oil plantations now cover large areas previously inhabited by dipterocarp species. Palm oil is used widely in the food and cosmetics industries.Choice Bis incorrect because, whilst fungal disease does occur in all natural rainforests, it has not caused widespread loss of dipterocarp species.Choice Cis incorrect because soil nutrient depletion will have occurred, but as a result of biodiversity loss, not a cause of it.Choice Dis incorrect because, whilst anthropogenic (human-caused) climate change is a cause of ecosystem loss, it is not the main cause in this case.

Anyfourof the following (should includeAT LEAST ONEfor compare andAT LEAST ONEfor contrast):Compare:→\ce{ -> }​BOTHare polysaccharides[1]→\ce{ -> }​BOTHare made up ofα\alphaα- glucose molecules[1]→\ce{ -> }​BOTHhave 1,4 and 1,6 linkages[1]→\ce{ -> }​BOTHare energy storage molecules[1]→\ce{ -> }​BOTHamylopectin in starch and glycogen are branched molecules[1]Contrast:→\ce{ -> }​glycogen is more branchedIN CONTRAST TOstarch,ORamylose of starch is unbranched, amylopectin has few branched chainsWHEREASglycogen is more branched[1]→\ce{ -> }​Starch is composed of two different polymers, amylose and amylopectinWHEREASglycogen is composed of only one polymer[1]→\ce{ -> }​starch is found in plant cellsWHEREASglycogen is found in animal cells[1][4 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Both starch and glycogen arepolysaccharides(✓\checkmark✓) made ofα\alphaα- glucose molecules(✓\checkmark✓), which have1,4 and 1,6 linkages(✓\checkmark✓). Starch is composed oftwo differentpolymers;amylose(unbranched and forms a helix) andamylopectin(branched), whereasglycogenis composed of onlyone type of polymer(✓\checkmark✓). Both amylopectin, in starch, and glycogen arebranchedmolecules (✓\checkmark✓), butglycogen is more branched than starch(✓\checkmark✓). Both areenergy storage(✓\checkmark✓)molecules butstarchis found inplant cellswhereasglycogenis found inanimal cells(✓\checkmark✓).For additional detail‾\underline{\textrm{For additional detail}}For additional detail​: , see 4:30 in Carbohydrates Key Concept Video:https://www.revisionvillage.com/ib-biology/sl/key-concepts/?keyConceptId=4fa07df3-4cd4-4a65-897b-96212f2186ee

[©Revision Village 2023. Created with BioRender.com]Explain the factors that limit cell size in humans.[4]Below is a diagram of aParamecium, a unicellular organism.

list.markScheme: Anyfourof the following:→\ce{ -> }​surface area affects the rate at which materials enter and leave the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​volume affects the rate at which materials are used and produced by the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​the surface area to volume ratio affects the rate of metabolism in a cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​the bigger the cell, the smaller the SAratio is[1]→\ce{ -> }​cells having a low SAratio cannot exchange materials fast enough[1]→\ce{ -> }​some cells,ORmotor neurons,ORmuscle cells,ORother named example in humans, are long and thin, which maintains a high SAratio[1][4 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Thesurface areaof a cell affects the rate at which materialsenter and leave cells(✓\checkmark✓). On the other hand, the cell’svolumeaffects the rate at which materials areused and produced(✓\checkmark✓). A small surface area to volume ratio is not ideal for human cells because itlimits the cell’s ability to export waste from the cytoplasmrapidly enough to meet thecytoplasm’s metabolic needs, such as the availability of oxygen(✓\checkmark✓).A large cell has a small surface area to volume ratio(✓\checkmark✓). Therefore, the transport of the substances is more efficient in small cells.Anyfourof the following (function of life must be mentioned when explaining howParameciumperforms this, to award mark):→\ce{ -> }​functions of life are metabolismANDgrowthANDreproductionANDnutritionANDhomeostasisANDmovementANDexcretionANDresponse to stimuli,ORsensitivity[1]→\ce{ -> }​movement inParameciumis demonstrated by cilia used to propel themselves through water[1]→\ce{ -> }​response is through reacting to stimuli in the environmentORavoidance of light[1]→\ce{ -> }​homeostasis is demonstrated by keeping the internal conditions within set limitsORexcess water is expelled by the contractile vacuole[1]→\ce{ -> }​metabolism is carried out by enzymes in the cytoplasm[1]→\ce{ -> }​growth is an irreversible increase in sizeORdry mass and paramecium achieve this  through accumulating organic matterORnutrients from food[1]→\ce{ -> }​reproduction function inParameciumis demonstrated by asexual division through binary fission,ORmitosis or micronucleus and amitotic division of macronucleusORsexually through conjugation[1]→\ce{ -> }​excretion is the removal of metabolic waste products from the cellORdiffusion of CO2out of the cell[1]→\ce{ -> }​nutrition is performed by ingesting smaller organisms and digesting them in vesiclesORthrough endocytosis[1][4 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Parameciumacquiresnutrientsby ingesting bacteria anddigesting them in vesicles(✓\checkmark✓). It exhibitsgrowthwhen itirreversibly increases in sizeby accumulating organic matter from ingestedfood(✓\checkmark✓).Parameciumrespondsto different environmental stimuli. For example, itchangesthedirectionof its movement once ittouchesa solid object (✓\checkmark✓).ExcretioninParameciumoccurs when waste products such ascarbon dioxide diffuse out of the cell(✓\checkmark✓).Parameciumreproducesboth asexually bybinary fission(✓\checkmark✓).

What do the two labelled organelles have in common?

Retrieved May 19, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/CategoryCopyright under CC BY 3.0]A.\hspace{1em}They have a single outer membraneB.\hspace{1em}They contain cristaeC.\hspace{1em}They are surrounded by a double membraneD.\hspace{1em}They contain starch grains
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:X is pointing to the nucleus and Y is pointing to a mitochondrion.Choice Ais incorrect as neither organelle has a single membrane.Choice Bis incorrect as only mitochondria contain cristae, the nucleus does not.Choice Dis incorrect as neither the nucleus or mitochondria contain starch grains.

list.title: Question 90
list.content: Which term to describe a property of water is matched to its correct definition?TermDefinitionA.\hspace{1em}Exerts buoyant forcesMuch energy is required to turn water into a vapourB.\hspace{1em}High specific heat capacityMuch energy is required to raise the temperature of 1kg water by 1 °CC.\hspace{1em}High boiling pointTurns from ice into steam at 100 °CD.\hspace{1em}Low viscosityEasily allows objects to float on the surface
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Water has a high specific heat capacity, meaning it can absorb or lose a lot of heat with only a small temperature change. This property helps maintain stable temperatures in organisms and aquatic environments.Choice Bis correct.Water exerts buoyant forces on objects, which means that it allows them to float easily on its surface. Objects that are less dense than the water they displace will experience an upward force greater than their weight, causing them to float.Choice Ais incorrect.A high boiling point means that liquid water turns into steam at 100°C;Choice Cis incorrect.Low viscosity means that water flows easily;Choice Dis incorrect.

list.title: Question 91
list.content: Which statement(s) below are challenges associated with the biological species concept (BSC)?I.The BSC assumes reproductive isolation, but some species are reproductively isolated only in certain environments.II.Fossil species cannot be assessed using the BSC due to the lack of observable mating behaviour.III.The BSC relies on morphological features, which can vary widely within a species.A.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis true because reproductive isolation may be context-dependent (e.g. due to geography or behaviour), making it unclear whether two populations are separate species under BSC.Statement IIis true because the BSC depends on observing whether organisms can interbreed. This is impossible with fossils, which are studied based on morphology and location, not reproductive behaviour.Statement IIIis false because the BSC specifically does not define species based on morphology; that is the morphological species concept. BSC focuses instead on reproductive capability, so this is not a valid criticism of BSC.Choice Bis correct because it includes only the two trueStatements IandII.Choice Ais incorrect as it is missing the trueStatement II.Choices CandDare incorrect as they include the falseStatement III.

list.title: Question 92
list.content:
Shown in diagrams A and B are two pairs of similar structures.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/f8372de6-7083-44a4-b525-006eed25005b/images/3cd298f7-34ad-4f4c-bc2b-6b7a3b43bf2f/BI0857.png)

[© Revision Village 2022]Which of the following statements correctly explain the structural similarities shown in diagrams A and B?I.Structural similarities in diagram A are primarily due to random mutations, not common ancestry.II.Structural similarities in diagram B are due to the fact they both perform similar functions.III.Diagram A depicts analogous structures, and diagram B depicts homologous structures.A.\hspace{1em}II and III onlyB.\hspace{1em}I and II onlyC.\hspace{1em}II onlyD.\hspace{1em}I, II and III
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because onlystatement IIcorrectly explains the structural similarities.The bird and insect wings are similar due to convergent evolution.Statement IIIis incorrect because diagram A depicts homologous structures, and diagram B depicts analogous structures.Statement Iis incorrect because humans and bats evolved from a common ancestor, and random mutations slowly gave rise to differences in the pentadactyl limb between different species.Choices A, BandDare all incorrect because they include eitherstatements IorIII, or both.

list.title: Question 93
list.content:
The micrograph shows the ultrastructure of a cell. What type of cell is shown and what process is it undergoing?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/fea1bf52-eec5-4eec-b5ea-8f2d8a25bff5/images/418a09cc-3e55-4c17-b147-d0dfe66c6d9a/BI1471%20fig1.png)

[Source: Adapted from Lewis, M. E., Belland, R. J., AbdelRahman, Y. M., Beatty, W. L., Aiyar, A. A., Zea, A. H., Greene, S. J., Marrero, L., Buckner, L. R., Tate, D. J., McGowin, C. L., Kozlowski, P. A., O’Brien, M., Lillis, R. A., Martin, D. H., & Quayle, A. J. (2014, May 15). Morphologic and molecular evaluation of chlamydia trachomatis growth in human endocervix reveals distinct growth patterns. Frontiers. Retrieved February 11 , 2024, from https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fcimb.2014.00071/full. Copyright free]\hspace{1em}Type of cell\hspace{1em}\hspace{1em}Process\hspace{1em}A.\hspace{1em}EukaryoticMitosisB.\hspace{1em}EukaryoticBinary fissionC.\hspace{1em}ProkaryoticMitosisD.\hspace{1em}ProkaryoticBinary fission
list.markScheme: DSample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Prokaryotic cells have an approximate diameter of 0.1−-−5.0  µm, whereas eukaryotic cells are significantly larger with a diameter range of 10−-−100  µm.  The cells in the micrograph have an approximate diameter of 0.5  µm, so are prokaryotic. Prokaryotic cells do not replicate themselves using mitosis, they use binary fission.Choice Dis correct.Choices AandBare incorrect as the cells in the micrograph are prokaryotic, not eukaryotic.Choice Cis incorrect as prokaryotic cells lack a mitotic spindle, so do not carry out mitosis, they carry out binary fission.

list.title: Question 94
list.content:
The image shows a ringed seal (Pusa hispida) that lives in the Arctic Sea.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/4b6b08e8-875d-4ac4-abba-a9c4c27a129b/images/d4b9a85b-c422-4e0a-b290-37d692fd87be/BI0835.png)

[Source: Adapted from: Kingfisher. (2021, May 29). Pusa hispida. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved from July 07, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Pusa_hispida. Copyright free]Distinguish between the physical properties of air and water that allow the seal to mostly live in the sea.[2]Ringed seals glide into the water head first from ice shelves, rather like humans diving into a pool head first. Explain the advantage of entering the water in this way rather than ‘belly-flopping’ into the water.[2]
list.markScheme: Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​water has a high specific heat capacityCOMPARED TOair, so its temperature remains relatively stable compared to airORso water remains relatively warmer during the winter[1]→\ce{ -> }​water has a higher densityCOMPARED TOair, and this supports the seal’s body weight as the water exerts buoyant forces on the seal[1]→\ce{ -> }​water has a higher viscosityCOMPARED TOair, providing the seal with more resistance to movementORmotion, which provides the seal with thrust and propulsion for swimming[1][2 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:The ringed seal is mostly able to live in water rather than air as water has ahigh specific heat capacitycompared to air, so itstemperature remains relatively stableso that the seal does not get too cold (✓\checkmark✓). Water has ahigher densitycompared to air, and thissupportsthe seal’sbody weightas the water exertsbuoyant forceson the seal (✓\checkmark✓).Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​water has a high surface tension due to hydrogen bondsTHEREFORE, ‘belly-flopping’ will cause pain due to the hydrogen bonds breaking forcefullyORgliding/diving causes hydrogen bonds between water molecules to be broken more gentlyORentering head first reduces the body surface area that initially comes into contact with the waterTHEREFOREreducing water resistance[1]→\ce{ -> }​gliding in is more energy-efficient for the seal as they use momentum generated from sliding on ice[1]→\ce{ -> }​gliding is more stealthy OR quiet, which allows the seal to avoid predators[1]→\ce{ -> }​gliding is more controlled, so the seal is at less risk of injury[1][2 marks maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Gliding in head first’ is advantageous as water has ahigh surface tensiondue to the high number of hydrogen bonds between water molecules, therefore,  ‘belly-flopping’ may causepainfrombreaking the hydrogen bondsforcefully (✓\checkmark✓). Gliding is morestealthyso the seal has more chance of catching prey orescaping predators(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 95
list.content:
The photograph below is of the sea oat (Unola paniculata). This plant is found on sand dunes.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/1af502cc-5332-4529-ac1e-57e68511c43f/images/54f3a7af-d48b-4bb1-9278-4e35299e8584/BI1424.png)

[Source: Adapted from Daniel Di Palma (2 Feb 2017)Miami Beach - Sand Dune Flora - Sea Oats in South Beach. Retrieved 31 Jan 2024 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=59792482. Copyright CC BY-SA 4.0]Explain how the sea oat (Unola paniculata) is adapted to survive in its environment.[3]Describe the importance of the solvent properties of water for transport in plants and humans.[3]
list.markScheme: Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​wide shallow root system that helps anchor them securely in shifting sandsORto allow rapid absorption of water from sandORto stabilise sand reducing rate of erosion[1]→\ce{ -> }​salt tolerance to survive exposure to salt spray from the sea[1]→\ce{ -> }​narrow leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration[1]→\ce{ -> }​flexibleORbendy stems allow sea oats to sway with the wind without breaking[1]→\ce{ -> }​long bristle-like structures on seeds that catch the wind to aid seed dispersal[1]→\ce{ -> }​some sea oat populations have a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria in their root nodules enabling them to survive in nutrient-poor beach soils[1]→\ce{ -> }​NodesORrhizomes allow regeneration after a fireORto reproduce asexually to survive being covered by sand[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Thewide, shallow rootsystem of sea oats allows them toanchor themselvesin the shifting sand (✓\checkmark✓) of the dunes and toabsorb water rapidly(✓\checkmark✓). Theirnarrow leaves reduce water lossthroughtranspiration(✓\checkmark✓) and theirflexible stemsallow them to survive thesea winds without breaking(✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following (needoneexample for plants andoneexample for humans to gain maximum marks):→\ce{ -> }​water molecules are polarORhave an uneven distribution of charge so attract other polar moleculesORions through hydrogen bondingORwater dissolves hydrophilic substances[1]→\ce{ -> }​in cellular transport water allows movement of ionsORhydrophilic moleculesORpolar molecules around the cell[1]Plants→\ce{ -> }​xylemORtranspiration stream carries mineralsORmineralsORpotassiumORcalciumORmagnesium from roots[1]→\ce{ -> }​phloem carries nutrientsORsucroseORcarbohydratesORglucoseORamino acids[1]Humans→\ce{ -> }​blood plasma dissolves and transports sodium chlorideORglucoseORamino acidsORwastesORhormonesORoxygenORcarbon dioxide[1]→\ce{ -> }​oxygen dissolution in aqueous lining of lungs allows uptake of oxygen into blood[1]→\ce{ -> }​waste products are filtered out at the kidneyORwastes are transported in glomerular filtrateORwater allows the transport of wastes through the nephron to the bladder for excretion[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Becausewater moleculesarepolar, hydrophilic substances dissolveinaqueous solutions(✓\checkmark✓). Inplants, water transportsmineralsupfromtheroots, where they have been absorbed from the soil, to where they are needed in the plant (✓\checkmark✓).  In humans, water acts as the medium forblood plasma, transportingessentialnutrientsandoxygenaround the body (✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 96
list.content:
The following electron micrograph shows part of an exocrine pancreas cell. Which of the labelled structures is responsible for the production of vesicles for exocytosis?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2f272307-8afa-40f2-baa3-3849afb23e89/images/ec933293-9b93-43e7-a9a2-a31402bd84cb/BI0532.png)

[Source: Adapted from Howard, L.  (n.d.).File: Pancreatic cells - TEM.jpg. Wikipedia.  Retrieved January, 3, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Pancreatic_cells_-_TEM.jpg. Copyright under Public Domain]
list.markScheme:
CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:The Golgi apparatus produces vesicles that contain substances destined for exocytosis from the cell. The Golgi apparatus is composed of stacks of flattened pouches called cisternae. These appear in a micrograph as the stacked, flattened discs indicated byChoice C.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2f272307-8afa-40f2-baa3-3849afb23e89/images/72bfb0b1-4b14-4045-980a-bd0565c72938/BI0532A.png)

[Source: Adapted from Howard, L.  (n.d.).File: Pancreatic cells - TEM.jpg. Wikipedia.  Retrieved January, 3, 2023, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Pancreatic_cells_-_TEM.jpg. Copyright under Public Domain]Choice Ais the plasma membrane,Choice Bis a lysosome andChoice Dis the nucleus.

list.title: Question 97
list.content: The table below shows the percentage of the amino acid sequences of cytochrome c shared between a human and four other species.Species PairCytochrome c sequence shared (%)Human–chimpanzee99Human–mouse87Human–chicken75Human–zebrafish50Which conclusion is best supported by these data?A.\hspace{1em}A human and a chimpanzee shared a common ancestor more recently than a human and a mouse.B.\hspace{1em}Cytochrome c has evolved faster in the chicken lineage than in the mouse lineage.C.\hspace{1em}The human–zebrafish divergence occurred most recently.D.\hspace{1em}The molecular clock runs at different rates in mammals and fish.
list.markScheme: AExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Ais correct because there is a higher percentage similarity for the cytochrome c amino acid sequence between the human and chimpanzee (99%) compared to the human and mouse (87%). This indicates less time for mutations to accumulate, meaning humans and chimpanzees shared a common ancestor more recently than humans and mice.Choice Bis incorrect because although the cytochrome c percentage similarity is lower in chickens (75%) than in mice (87%), this alone does not confirm that cytochrome c evolved faster in the chicken lineage. To determine evolutionary rates, both sequence similarity and known divergence times are needed.Choice Cis incorrect because the lowest sequence similarity (50%) between human and zebrafish suggests the longest time since divergence, not the most recent.Choice Dis incorrect because differences in sequence similarity alone cannot demonstrate variation in molecular clock rates. The molecular clock is a concept based on the idea that mutations accumulate at a relatively constant rate over time in most species. To conclude rate differences, both the time since divergence and the number of accrued changes must both be known.

list.title: Question 98
list.content: What characteristic of DNA allows it to serve as a template for both DNA replication and mRNA synthesis?A.\hspace{1em}The genetic code in DNA is universal across all organismsB.\hspace{1em}Hydrogen bonding enables the correct alignment of deoxyribonucleotides and ribonucleotides in newly synthesised strandsC.\hspace{1em}DNA’s double helix structure means one strand can be replicated at the same time as the other is being transcribedD.\hspace{1em}The strong sugar-phosphate backbone
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct. During both replication and transcription, nucleotides are aligned along the DNA template strand according to base-pairing rules. Hydrogen bonds form between the nitrogenous bases of the template DNA strand and the incoming deoxyribonucleotides (during replication) or ribonucleotides (in transcription).The genetic code being universal means that the same codons code for the same amino acids in all organisms. However, this relates to protein synthesis, not to how DNA acts as a template for replication or transcription;Choice Ais incorrect.Choice Cis incorrect because replication and transcription can’t occur on opposite strands simultaneously.Choice Dis incorrect because while the sugar-phosphate backbone is a feature of both DNA and RNA strands that provides structural stability, it does not explain how DNA can interact with both DNA and RNA nucleotides.

list.title: Question 99
list.content: How are the chromosomes in a karyogram ordered?A.\hspace{1em}By analogous pairsB.\hspace{1em}By number of genesC.\hspace{1em}By sizeD.\hspace{1em}By position of the centromeres
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because the chromosomes in a karyogram are ordered in homologous pairs from largest to smallest.Choice Ais incorrect because chromosomes are grouped in homologous pairs (one from each parent), not analogous pairs.Choice Bis incorrect because the number of genes on each chromosome is highly variable, and genes do not have a consistent length. Although the chromosomes are aligned with their centromeres in a karyogram, the question only asks about the order of the chromosomes, which is not dependent on centromere position; thus,Choice Dis also incorrect.

list.title: Question 100
list.content: Which of the following thermal properties of water isincorrectlymatched?PropertyWaterA.\hspace{1em}Melting Point0°\degree°CB.\hspace{1em}Specific Heat Capacity2.2 Jg−1\text{g}^{-1}g−1°C−1\degree \text{C}^{-1}°C−1C.\hspace{1em}Latent Heat of Vaporisation760 Jg−1\text{g}^{-1}g−1D.\hspace{1em}Boiling Point100°\degree°C
list.markScheme: BExplanation:‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation:}}Explanation:​Choice Bis incorrectly matched. The specific heat capacity of water is 4.2 Jg−1°C−1\text{g}^{-1} \degree \text{C}^{-1}g−1°C−1, not 2.2  Jg−1°C−1\text{g}^{-1} \degree \text{C}^{-1}g−1°C−1.Choice A,C, andDare correctly matched.

list.title: Question 101
list.content:
All organisms contain genetic material. The type, quantity and location of genetic material differ between kingdoms and species.State if the cell shown in the image is a prokaryotic or eukaryotic cell. Give a reason for your answer.[1]

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8024806a-71b0-45c1-abd9-26abe1b9d775/images/4acbd2c2-a08b-4399-bb2b-e8c3deecb828/BI0199.png)

[Source: Adapted from Ruiz (16th January 2007).File: Prokaryote cell diagram international.svg.Wikimedia commons. Retrieved 18th May 2022 from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Prokaryote_cell_diagram_international.svg. Copyright-free]Distinguish between prokaryotic and eukaryotic DNA.[2]
list.markScheme: The following:→\ce{ -> }​prokaryotic cellBECAUSEchromosome is loopedORno nucleus is present[1][1 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:This is aprokaryotic(✓\checkmark✓) cell because the chromosome isnot within a nucleus(✓\checkmark✓).Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​prokaryotic DNA is looped,BUTthe majority of eukaryotic DNA is linear[1]→\ce{ -> }​prokaryotic DNA is not contained in a nucleus,BUTthe majority of eukaryotic DNA is found within a nucleus[1]→\ce{ -> }​prokaryotic DNA is found in a chromosome and plasmidsWHEREASthe majority of eukaryotic DNA is found in chromosomes and not in plasmids[1]→\ce{ -> }​the majority of eukaryotic DNA is always associated with proteins (histones)WHILEprokaryotic DNA is not bound to proteins (with the exception ofArchaewhose DNA is associated with proteins)[1][2 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Prokaryotic DNA is looped while the majority of eukaryoticDNA is linear(✓\checkmark✓). DNA can be found inplasmids in some prokaryotes(✓\checkmark✓), while the only plasmids found in eukaryotes are present in mitochondria and chloroplasts.

list.title: Question 102
list.content:
Which of the following pairs of limbs are homologous?A.\hspace{2cm}B.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/95ce83ee-4cfc-4990-979c-7472080d185f/images/b2b1c0e9-ab57-4231-aee5-6518a9f9bc32/BI1577A.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/95ce83ee-4cfc-4990-979c-7472080d185f/images/62b811f3-008e-4d9f-9a9b-44a6e73f64f6/BI1577B.png)

C.D.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/95ce83ee-4cfc-4990-979c-7472080d185f/images/546632a5-9c94-4e3d-9ed0-eef9040b8de0/BI1577C.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/95ce83ee-4cfc-4990-979c-7472080d185f/images/ec7a434a-80b0-4dba-9293-d513594f781c/BI1577D.png)

[© Revision Village 2024. Created with BioRender.com]
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because the horse and sea lion limbs have the same bones in the same order. This is the result of common ancestry between the two species, making these structures homologous despite their different functions.Choices A, B,andCare incorrect because these are examples of analogous structures as a result of convergent evolution. Analogous structures share a common function but do not share a common ancestry. A further clue is that horse and sea lion are both mammals, whereas the other pairs of animals belong to different taxonomic groups (Choice A= mammal, insect;Choice B= mammal, crustacean;Choice C= mollusc, echinoderm).

list.title: Question 103
list.content:
It is thought that the Congo River divided a population of the common ancestor of bonobos (Pan paniscus) and chimpanzees (Pan troglodytes), resulting in geographic isolation.  Which correctly pairs theoretical selection pressures and consequent adaptations of the two populations?

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/95d2e015-b514-409e-bc3c-a4d60240f3d6/images/e9f0bfbf-b64e-4476-8fa3-e01eb43f2eb1/BI0859.png)
list.markScheme: BExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Bis correct because a scarcity of food as well as competition with gorillas, led to increased aggression in the ancestral population to chimpanzees and plentiful food on the south side of the river, as well as an absence of gorillas led to increased cooperation in the ancestral population of bonobos.Choice Ais incorrect because there was and is no difference in solar radiation on either side of the Congo River.Choice Cis incorrect because the selection pressures and adaptations are reversed in terms of where they existed (south side vs. north side).Choice Dis incorrect because food scarcity led to more aggression, and plentiful food led to more cooperation.

list.title: Question 104
list.content:
Which of the following represents the correct structure of RNA?A.\hspace{2cm}B.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ac6dd223-2d74-4170-a8cf-7210719060f1/images/8671af0f-da99-480e-80ca-0fdf4b17f42b/BI1565A.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ac6dd223-2d74-4170-a8cf-7210719060f1/images/527f702a-baf1-4b73-babd-c3c83e22f26f/BI1565B.png)

C.D.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ac6dd223-2d74-4170-a8cf-7210719060f1/images/7b9be57f-fb83-43ae-b478-a6656a0c6960/BI1565C.png)



![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ac6dd223-2d74-4170-a8cf-7210719060f1/images/54ad8ec1-a9ea-4fc9-8c0d-3e39ee4a6651/BI1565D.png)

[© Revision Village 2024. Created with BioRender.com]
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Cis correct because RNA is a single-stranded nucleic acid that contains adenine (A), cytosine (C), uracil (U), and guanine (G) nucleotide bases, while DNA is a double-stranded nucleic acid containing thymine (T) instead of uracil. The nucleotide bases are covalently bonded to a pentose sugar, which is covalently bonded to a phosphate at the 5’ and 3’ ends.Choice Ais incorrect as this is the structure of a DNA molecule, including a thymine base.Choice Bis incorrect because RNA does not contain thymine.Choice Dis incorrect because the diagram shows a double-stranded molecule similar to DNA,  but the strands are incorrectly depicted as parallel instead of the correct anti-parallel orientation.

list.title: Question 105
list.content:
Below is a picture of a water strider (Gerrissp.\textit{Gerris sp.}Gerris sp.).

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/acd82ba4-e9b6-4ad4-9ae7-0cba2f0322ee/images/98250f20-3d55-4380-b054-95cf70aeb72c/BI0187i_2.2.png)

[Source: Schnobby. (2010).Water Strider. Wikimedia Commons. Retrieved April 27, 2022, from https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File: Water_strider_in_a_pond.jpg. Copyright by CC BY-SA 3.0]Explain why the water strider (Gerrissp.\textit{Gerris sp.}Gerris sp.) does not sink.[2]Describe, using an example, the importance of water as a solvent in living organisms.[3]
list.markScheme:
Anytwoof the following:→\ce{ -> }​cohesion,ORcohesive properties, of water is responsible[1]→\ce{ -> }​water molecules bind to other water molecules[1]→\ce{ -> }​water molecules form intermolecular hydrogen bonds[1]→\ce{ -> }​cohesion results in high surface tension of water[1]→\ce{ -> }​legs of the insect are hydrophobic[1][2 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Cohesion(✓\checkmark✓) is the water property that is responsible for this phenomenon. Watermolecules bind with other water molecules(✓\checkmark✓) throughhydrogen bonds(✓\checkmark✓)to createhigh surface tension(✓\checkmark✓). The legs of the water strider are covered in a secreted wax, making themhydrophobic(✓\checkmark✓), which allows the water strider to move on top of the water.Anythreeof the following (maximum of 2 marks if no example is provided):→\ce{ -> }​metabolic reactions can only happen in solutions[1]→\ce{ -> }​water dissolves hydrophilic substances needed for life processes[1]→\ce{ -> }​substances can be transported through the water-based solutions[1]→\ce{ -> }​blood plasma dissolves and transports sodium chlorideORglucoseORamino acidsORany other valid example in animals[1]→\ce{ -> }​water dissolves and transports nutrientsORminerals needed by plantsORany other valid example in plants[1][3 mark maximum]Sample Answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample Answer}}Sample Answer​:Water dissolves hydrophilic substances(✓\checkmark✓)
required formetabolic reactions(✓\checkmark✓) which can only occur in solution.  Dissolved substances can react with each other and also betransported(✓\checkmark✓)to other parts of an organism. For example, water dissolves and transports glucose in theblood plasma(✓\checkmark✓).

list.title: Question 106
list.content: Outline the steps in calculating the magnification of a micrograph.[4]Describe the steps taken to focus on a specimen using the 40x objective lens of a light microscope.[4]
list.markScheme: Anyfourof the following:→\ce{->}​measure (using a ruler) the scale bar on the drawingORmicrograph[1]→\ce{->}​note the stated length which the scale bar represents[1]→\ce{->}​convert the represented and real length or scale bar into the same units[1]→\ce{->}​M= I/AORany correct example of the calculation[1][4 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:To calculate the magnification of a microphotograph, the first step is to measurethe scale bar using a ruler(✓\checkmark✓). The second step isto note the length the scale bar represents(✓\checkmark✓). This gives you the actual size of the image. These two measurements should be converted tothe same units(✓\checkmark✓). The last step is todivide the length measured by the ruler by the length represented by the scale bar(✓\checkmark✓). During this calculation, units cancel out.  Therefore, themagnification does not have units.Anyfourof the following:→\ce{->}​use the lowest powerOR4X objective lens first[1]→\ce{->}​place the specimenORslide directly below the objective lensORon the centre of the microscope stage[1]→\ce{->}​turn the coarse focus knob to focus on the specimen at 4X[1]→\ce{->}​adjust the turretORchange the objective lens so the medium powerOR10X objective lens is used[1]→\ce{->}​refocus on the specimen using a fine focus knob at 10X and 40X[1]→\ce{->}​adjust the turretORchange the objective lens, so the high powerOR40X objective lens is used[1]→\ce{->}​while fine focusing always move the lens away from the slide[1][4 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Place the specimenin the centreof the microscope stage  (✓\checkmark✓).  Use the4x objective lens first(✓\checkmark✓) and use thecoarse focus knob(✓\checkmark✓) to focus on the specimen.  Adjust the position of the specimen so it is in the middle of the field of view and thenswitch to the 10x(✓\checkmark✓) objective lens andrefocus using the fine focus knob, (✓\checkmark✓) by moving lensaway from the specimen(✓\checkmark✓) to prevent lens breakage.  Finally, switch to the40x objective lens(✓\checkmark✓) and use thefine focus knobto refocus on the specimen.

list.title: Question 107
list.content:
The micrograph below showsCyanobacteria, which contain chlorophyll.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/c3dfa29a-d486-40b4-9fc1-d44b66ce3fc7/images/937853fc-bf32-495b-aba7-33e0cf82a199/BI1197-SL.png)

[Source: Adapted from Thompson L. and Whatson N. (2007, January 1).Cyanobacteria.  Wikipedia.  Retrieved on September 6, 2023, from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyanobacteria#. Copyright under CCO]Using your knowledge and the micrograph, state two features that would indicate that this is a bacterium.[2]Outline the structural differences between animal and plant cells.[3]Explain how light energy is used in photosynthesis to carry out anabolic reactions.[3]
list.markScheme: Anytwoof the following→\ce{ -> }​cell wall of peptidoglycan[1]→\ce{ -> }​naked DNAORDNA not associated with histonesORproteins[1]→\ce{ -> }​nucleoidORDNA free in cytoplasm[1]→\ce{ -> }​no membrane bound organelles[1]→\ce{ -> }​70s ribosomes[1]→\ce{ -> }​cell smaller than 10μm[1][2 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Two features that would indicate that this is a bacterium are it hasno membrane-bound organelles(✓\checkmark✓) and70s ribosomes(✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​plant cells have a cell wall,WHEREASanimal cells do not[1]→\ce{ -> }​plant cells generally have a central vacuoleWHEREASanimal cells do not[1]→\ce{ -> }​plant cells have chloroplastsWHEREASanimal cells do not[1]→\ce{ -> }​animal cells may have lysosomesWHEREASplant cells do not[1]→\ce{ -> }​animal cells may have ciliaORflagellaWHEREASplant cells do not[1]→\ce{ -> }​animal cells have centriolesWHEREASplant cells do not[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Plant cells have acell wall, central vacuoleandchloroplasts, whereasanimalcellsdo not(✓\checkmark✓) (✓\checkmark✓) (✓\checkmark✓).Anythreeof the following:→\ce{ -> }​light energy is absorbed by chlorophyll[1]→\ce{ -> }​light energy is transferred to electronsORis used to excite electrons[1]→\ce{ -> }​light energy splitting water moleculesORphotolysis releases electrons for the electron transport chainORhydrogen ions for use in ATP production[1]→\ce{ -> }​light energy is used to synthesise ATP from ADP and inorganic phosphateORNADPH from electrons and one proton[1]→\ce{ -> }​NADPHORATP is used to make larger organic compoundsORglucoseORstarchORother named organic compound from carbon dioxide[1][3 marks maximum]Sample answer‾\underline{\textrm{Sample answer}}Sample answer​:Light energy isabsorbedbychlorophyll(✓\checkmark✓) and is used toexcite electrons(✓\checkmark✓).  These electrons reduceNADP+to formNADPH, which is an anabolic reaction (✓\checkmark✓).  Energy present inNADPHis then used toproduce glucosefromcarbon dioxide(✓\checkmark✓).  This is also an anabolic reaction.

list.title: Question 108
list.content:
The diagram shows three dividing eukaryotic cells (not drawn to scale).

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d44418d9-eb6c-4a6b-9968-42a3f6f183f2/images/57370bbe-8a79-4a6c-a4b4-6083ac8eae6f/BI2852%20A2.2%20core%20MCQ.jpeg.JPEG)

[© Revision Village 2025. Created in BioRender.com]Which row correctly pairs each cell with its type?Cell XCell YCell ZA.\hspace{1em}Palisade mesophyllYeastLiverB.\hspace{1em}LiverPalisade mesophyllYeastC.\hspace{1em}YeastLiverPalisade mesophyllD.\hspace{1em}Palisade mesophyllLiverYeast
list.markScheme: CExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Cell Xis undergoing budding, a process characteristic of unicellular fungi like yeast. The cell also has a cell wall, a large vacuole and no chloroplasts, reinforcing that this cell is indeed a fungal cell, such as yeast.Cell Yhas no cell wall, no visible vacuoles and there are centrioles in the dividing cells, indicating that this is a dividing animal cell, such as a liver cell.Cell Zhas is dividing into daughter cells, each of which has a cell wall, vacuole, and chloroplasts. The cell is also dividing evenly by laying down a cell plate between the cells, which will develop into the cell walls of the new cells. These are all features of plant cells, such as palisade mesophyll cells.Choice Cis therefore the correct answer to this question.

list.title: Question 109
list.content: Which of the following is the correct pairing of a nucleotide component and its description?ComponentDescriptionA.\hspace{1em}SugarVaries between RNA and DNA to form genetic codeB.\hspace{1em}BaseProvides structure to the backboneC.\hspace{1em}PhosphateForms bonds with the base and sugarD.\hspace{1em}BaseVaries along nucleic acid to form genetic code
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because the sequence of nitrogenous bases is what encodes genetic information in DNA and RNA. This is the only row with a fully correct and precise description.Choice Ais incorrect because, while the sugar differs between DNA (deoxyribose) and RNA (ribose), it does not form the genetic code. The code is carried in the base sequence, not the sugar.Choice Bis incorrect because Bases are not part of the backbone (which is made of sugar–phosphate units). Bases project from the backbone and form the coding region, not the structure.Choice Cis incorrect because phosphate forms bonds with sugars, not with bases. Bases attach to the sugar (at carbon 1'), not to phosphate.

list.title: Question 110
list.content: Which of the following has/have directly contributed to biodiversity loss?I.The overhunting of African elephants for their ivoryII.The expansion of cities like São Paulo, BrazilIII.The spread of the invasive zebra mussels in North America through ballast water from shipsA.\hspace{1em}I onlyB.\hspace{1em}II onlyC.\hspace{1em}I and IIID.\hspace{1em}I, II, and III
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Statement Iis true because overhunting is one cause of the biodiversity crisis.Statement IIis true because urbanisation is a cause of the biodiversity crisis.Statement IIIis true because the introduction/spread of pests, diseases and alien species due to global transport are causes of the biodiversity crisis.Therefore,Choice Dis the correct answer asStatements I, IIandIIIare true.

list.title: Question 111
list.content: What sequence of events usually occur during the process of speciation?A.\hspace{1em}Reproductive isolation → one species becomes two species → random mutationsB.\hspace{1em}Random mutations → reproductive isolation → one species becomes another speciesC.\hspace{1em}Geographic isolation → reproductive isolation → one species becomes another speciesD.\hspace{1em}Geographic isolation → reproductive isolation → one species becomes two species
list.markScheme: DExplanation‾\underline{\textrm{Explanation}}Explanation​:Choice Dis correct because geographic isolation leads to a buildup of different mutations between two populations, leading to reproductive isolation and the production of two species from one.Choice Ais incorrect, as reproductive isolation cannot occur prior to a buildup of random mutations.Choices BandCare incorrect because speciation involves one species becoming two, not one.
